I have a simple library, with some testers compiled with a maven
[2.05] pom=
.

Unit testing is performed with JUnit 3.8.1 [fairly standard so far]

Whe=
n compiling/testing/running from an IDE the unit tests compile and
run with=
out problems.

When compiling from the command line [mvn clean package] the=
 compile
stage of the build fails with

C:\src\SearchInterface\SearchCore\s=
rc\main\java\test\ecom\search\SearchBase.java:[209,12]
cannot resolve symbo=
l
symbol  : method fail (java.lang.String)
location: class test.ecom.search=
.SearchBase

SearchBase extends TestCase, and the fail(String) method has b=
een in
the 3.8.x libraries for some time.

Could the JUnit jar posted to th=
e maven repositories be invalid? [and
now off to the maven mailing list...]=
